context: Break room. The coffee machine is broken again. It's always broken.

start.speaker: Jamie
start.text: The Keurig's dead again. I think it's a metaphor. ...Do you ever think about what we'd be doing if we weren't doing... this?
start.internal: (Jamie started the same week as you. They're the only person here who doesn't say "synergy" unironically.)

choices.text: Every single day. I had a dream about spreadsheets last night. A good one. That's when I knew.
I don't know, man. This is fine. The benefits are good.
choices.internal: ("The benefits are good" — the mantra of someone who's given up.)

choices.text: I was going to be a marine biologist. I still have the poster.

honest.speaker: Jamie
honest.text: A GOOD dream about spreadsheets? That's... actually terrifying. Maybe we should both go outside. Touch grass. Do normal people things.

choices.text: When? We have the Q3 review presentation.
Let's get lunch. Not Sweetgreen. Real food.

deflect.speaker: Jamie
deflect.text: The benefits. Yeah. My dental plan has been the highlight of my twenties. I got a crown last month. That's my biggest accomplishment this year. A crown.

choices.text: At least you have a crown. Royalty, basically.

dream.speaker: Jamie
dream.text: Marine biologist! That rules. I wanted to be a park ranger. Now I range... the fourth floor? I patrol meeting rooms. Same energy.

choices.text: At what point did you trade the forest for the fluorescents?

q3.speaker: Jamie
q3.text: Right. The Q3 review. Where we present numbers to people who already know the numbers. Theater. Corporate theater. We should get matching masks.

lunch.speaker: Jamie
lunch.text: Real food. Bold. There's a place down the block that makes sandwiches the size of your head. Patricia will send a passive-aggressive Slack if we take more than 45 minutes. But what's she gonna do, fire us? ...Actually don't answer that.

royalty.speaker: Jamie
royalty.text: King Jamie of Desk 4B. My kingdom is a cubicle and my subjects are three dead succulents. ...Anyway, back to the presentation. The kingdom demands it.

trade.speaker: Jamie
trade.text: Student loans. The answer is always student loans. I crunched the numbers once — my degree cost more per hour than this job pays. So now I'm here. Crunching different numbers. It's poetic if you don't think about it too hard.
trade.internal: (You both sit there for a moment. The broken Keurig gurgles. It's strangely comforting.)
